title: RestEasy Classic: Response is chunked although Content-Length set
body:
### Describe the bug

Given a Quarkus project with RESTEasy-Classic extension and the following JAX-RS Resource

```java
public class ContentLengthResource {
    @GET
    public Response handleWithCl() {
        String data = Strings.repeat("test", 10_000);
        byte[] body = data.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);
        return Response.ok(body, "application/octet-stream").header("Content-Length", body.length).build();
    }
}
```

I expect that I can use this resource to download the generated bytes with a browser and see the download progress. The browser progress indicator is dependant on the Content-Length header. As this resource is larger than the Quarkus buffer size, the response is chunked and I do not see a progress indicator.

### Expected behavior

I expect a HTTP Response with the following header set

```
Content-Length: 40000
```

### Actual behavior

The `Content-Length` is removed, because the response is chunked. The HTTP response header includes
```
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
```

### How to Reproduce?

I have modified the io.quarkus.resteasy.test.ContentLengthTestCase test case at https://github.com/yreifschneider/quarkus/commit/3576b35ed922eee625e3dd4c0f8fd89466aa9394. The test was faulty, because the RestAssured call recorder did not remove the `Content-Length` header but in an actual running Quarkus application, the header is removed.
